Sentencas: The natural gas fueled system coupling solid oxide fuel cell, water gas shift reaction, thermal swing adsorption and proton exchange membrane fuel cell (SOFC-WGS-TSA-PEMFC) could have a high efficiency and fast response for power generation.
Titulo: Thermo-economic modeling and analysis of an NG-fueled SOFC-WGS-TSA-PEMFC hybrid energy conversion system for stationary electricity power generation

Sentencas: The thermo-economic analyses show that the hybrid system could have a better economy for electricity generation, whose specific electricity cost with LaNi5 as the thermal swing adsorption (TSA) working medium is 4.058 cent/kW h only, remarkably lower than that of a standard power plant (5.46 cent/kW h).
Titulo: Thermo-economic modeling and analysis of an NG-fueled SOFC-WGS-TSA-PEMFC hybrid energy conversion system for stationary electricity power generation

Sentencas: The sensitivity analysis indicates the low sensitivity of the system to the market price fluctuation.
Titulo: Thermo-economic modeling and analysis of an NG-fueled SOFC-WGS-TSA-PEMFC hybrid energy conversion system for stationary electricity power generation

Sentencas: When using the Mg+2 wt%Ni or TiFe metal hydride with the higher hydrogen capacity and the cheaper price as the TSA working medium for H-2 production, the specific electricity energy cost can be further reduced to 3.958 cent/kW h, which could be more economical than that with the traditional pressure swing adsorption or the membrane reactor for H-2 production.
Titulo: Thermo-economic modeling and analysis of an NG-fueled SOFC-WGS-TSA-PEMFC hybrid energy conversion system for stationary electricity power generation

Sentencas: In addition, the large-scale electricity power generation helps to cut down the system specific cost.
Titulo: Thermo-economic modeling and analysis of an NG-fueled SOFC-WGS-TSA-PEMFC hybrid energy conversion system for stationary electricity power generation

Sentencas: These results reveal that the hybrid system could be a promising and economical energy conversion system for stationary electricity power generation.
Titulo: Thermo-economic modeling and analysis of an NG-fueled SOFC-WGS-TSA-PEMFC hybrid energy conversion system for stationary electricity power generation
